verses.kjv: Hear ye now what the LORD saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.
verses.web: Listen now to what LORD says: “Arise, plead your case before the mountains, and let the hills hear what you have to say.
verses.ct: Listen to what the LORD says: "Stand up and make your case before the mountains. Let the hills hear your voice."

verses.kjv: Hear ye, O mountains, the LORD’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the LORD hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.
verses.web: Hear, you mountains, LORD’s controversy, and you enduring foundations of the earth; for LORD has a controversy with his people, and he will contend with Israel.
verses.ct: Mountains, hear the LORD's accusation! Listen, you ancient foundations of the earth! The LORD has a case against his people — he is bringing charges against Israel.

verses.kjv: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.
verses.web: My people, what have I done to you? How have I burdened you? Answer me!
verses.ct: "My people, what have I done to you? How have I burdened you? Answer me!

verses.kjv: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
verses.web: For I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage. I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
verses.ct: I brought you up out of Egypt and freed you from slavery. I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam to lead you.

verses.kjv: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the LORD.
verses.web: My people, remember now what Balak king of Moab devised, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim to Gilgal, that you may know the righteous acts of LORD.”
verses.ct: My people, remember what Balak king of Moab plotted against you, and how Balaam son of Beor responded to him. Remember your journey from Shittim to Gilgal, so you can understand how faithfully the LORD has treated you."

verses.kjv: Wherewith shall I come before the LORD, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?
verses.web: How shall I come before LORD, and bow myself before the exalted God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old?
verses.ct: What should I bring when I come before the LORD? How should I bow before God on high? Should I come with burnt offerings — with year-old calves?

verses.kjv: Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
verses.web: Will LORD be pleased with thousands of rams? With tens of thousands of rivers of oil? Shall I give my firstborn for my disobedience? The fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
verses.ct: Would the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams or with ten thousand rivers of oil? Should I sacrifice my firstborn child for my rebellion — the fruit of my own body for the sin of my soul?

verses.kjv: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?
verses.web: He has shown you, O man, what is good. What does LORD require of you, but to act justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?
verses.ct: He has already shown you what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? Simply this: act justly, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God.

verses.kjv: The LORD’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.
verses.web: LORD’s voice calls to the city, and wisdom sees your name: “Listen to the rod, and he who appointed it.
verses.ct: The LORD's voice calls out to the city — and it is wise to fear his name: "Pay attention to the rod of punishment, and to the one who appointed it.

verses.kjv: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?
verses.web: Are there yet treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and a short ephah that is accursed?
verses.ct: Are there still ill-gotten treasures in the houses of the wicked? Are there still dishonest measures — those short ephahs that I despise?

verses.kjv: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?
verses.web: Shall I be pure with dishonest scales, and with a bag of deceitful weights?
verses.ct: Can I overlook dishonest scales and bags full of rigged weights?

verses.kjv: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
verses.web: Her rich men are full of violence, her inhabitants speak lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their speech.
verses.ct: The rich among you are full of violence. The people speak lies, and their tongues are trained in deception.

verses.kjv: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.
verses.web: Therefore I also have struck you with a grievous wound. I have made you desolate because of your sins.
verses.ct: So I have already begun to strike you down, bringing you to ruin because of your sins.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.
verses.web: You shall eat, but not be satisfied. Your humiliation will be within you. You will store up, but not save; and that which you save I will give up to the sword.
verses.ct: You will eat but never feel satisfied — emptiness will gnaw at you from within. You will try to save up, but nothing will be preserved. Whatever you do manage to keep, I will hand over to the sword.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.
verses.web: You will sow, but won’t reap. You will tread the olives, but won’t anoint yourself with oil; and crush grapes, but won’t drink the wine.
verses.ct: You will plant crops but never harvest them. You will press olives but never use the oil. You will crush grapes but never drink the wine.

verses.kjv: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
verses.web: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of Ahab’s house. You walk in their counsels, that I may make you a ruin, and her inhabitants a hissing; And you will bear the reproach of my people.”
verses.ct: You have followed the wicked practices of Omri and carried out everything the house of Ahab did. You have walked in their ways. So I will turn you into a wasteland, and your people into an object of mockery. You will bear the disgrace that my people deserve."
